For the most part, everything is pretty easy to grasp, however, there are some nuances that you should be aware of before diving in!'' ''__Passage of Time__'' Every day is broken up into 7 major blocks of time: * Morning * Late Morning * Noon * Early Afternoon * Afternoon * Evening * Night The vast majority of actions in the game will cause time to pass, and your day will need to be planned around how much time any one activity or interactin requires. Any action in the game that would cause time to pass will be proceeded with either a <<t1>> or a <<t2>> indicator, noting how many blocks of time will progress for taking that action. Going to sleep at night will always cause the day to end, taking you to the following morning. On work days, you'll arrive at The Company in the late morning, and get back home in the evening. You'll need to plan ahead to make the most of your limited time at both locations! ''__Stats and Relationships__'' This information used to be relevant, back in the 4.0 days, but due to some major systems overhauls taking place we'll go ahead and skip over this for now! ''__Gender__'' Your gender is not a boolean value, but rather a sliding scale. While you've already decided on your starting gender, it's entirely possible for this to change drastically over the course of the game, between male, female and various inbetween states! ''__Sidebar__'' All the aforementioned information can be tracked via the sidebar to the left. If you're playing The Company in a browser you'll see it at all times unless closed, however on a mobile device you'll need to tap the icon in the upper left corner. This is also where you can save, load and restart the game. ''__Closing__'' That's enough to get you going, but there's a lot more information that you'll need to discover on your own! Experiment, explore, and even when you think you've exhausted all available options keep poking around, you may even have to retrace your foot steps. Remember, there's no ==right== wrong way to play! • [[Hurray!|Tutorial][$c=2]] <<case 2>>\ <<img "tutorial" "saya" 1>>\ <<nm $saya "Well that's about the size of it. I trust you to make good choices!">>\ ''$penny.name laughs and the two of share a beer.'' <<set $player.has.beer to false>>\ <<if $game.chapter > 1 and not $player.control.pennyCuckold>>\ ''You notice $penny.name smiling to herself. She seems to be happy working with you.'' <</if>>\ <<else>> ''You and $penny.name chat about various topics and before you know it the time has flown by.'' <</if>>\ • [[Go back to lab|Lab][$time.passTime(1)]]<<loc_Lab>> <<set _yield to $matYield, _HaveMats to false>>\ <<unset _i, _m>>\ ''Select the material you wish to prepare, or a serum you wish to create. Preparing materials and creating serums will take time.'' <<if $c is "PennyHelping">>\ <<set _percent to (100*$penny.matBonus)-100>>\ <<img "penny">>\ @@.gain;$penny.name is helping you in the lab today. With her assistance, your yield from preparing materials should be increased by roughly _percent%. Her assistance will also increase production speed when creating serums.@@ <<set _PennyHelping to true>>\ <</if>>\ <span id="crafting">\ <table style="width:100%"> <caption>Prepare Materials</caption> <tr> <th style="text-align:center;">Craft</th> <th style="text-align:center;">Have</th> <th style="text-align:center;">Description</th> </tr> <tr> <td style="text-align:center;"><<click "$chem[0].name">> <<replace "#crafting">>\ ''You decide to prepare a _yield mL batch of $chem[0].name to be used for serum production.'' <<if _PennyHelping>>\ <<set _yield to Math.floor(_yield * $penny.matBonus)>>\ @@.gain;With $penny.name's assistance, your yield should increase to a total of _yield mL.@@ <</if>>\ ''Are you sure you want to continue?'' • <<click "Prepare the $chem[0].name">> <<replace "#crafting">>\ <<set $chem[0].qty += _yield>>\ ''You <<if _PennyHelping>>and $penny.name <</if>>successfully prepare a _yield mL batch of $chem[0].name.
